The claim is based on a tweet by Wendy D: the Democratic gubernatorial nominee in Texas, where she stated that women are paid 82 cents for every dollar a man earns in Texas.
The claim is supported by a fact sheet f: Families, an advocacy group for workplace fairness, which cites data from the U.S Census Bureau's American Community Survey (ACS) conducted in 2011.
The fact sheet provides specific numbers: stating that in Texas, on average, a woman who holds a full-time job is paid $35,301 per year while a man who holds a full-time job is paid $43,160 per year.
